```{r message=FALSE}
# Packages
options(scipen = 999)
library(tidyverse)
library(reactable)
library(webshot2)
library(reactablefmtr)
```

$$\\[0.25in]$$
This is a supplemental material for the manuscript entitled: "XXXX". The Bayes Factor (BF) interpretation of Table 1 is based on Lee and Wagenmakers (2013). The H0 and H1 mean that treatments are the same or different, respectively.

$$\\[0.1in]$$

```{r}
read_csv("data/bf.csv") %>% 
  reactable(., theme = fivethirtyeight(), 
            filterable = TRUE,
            resizable = TRUE,
            searchable = FALSE,
            wrap = TRUE,
            defaultPageSize = 11,
            defaultColDef = colDef(minWidth = 200)) %>% 
  add_title("Table 1. Bayes Factor interpretation", font_size = 15)
```

$$\\[0.1in]$$
The treatment contrasts of inswath spray solution deposition are compared (Table 2). See the BF and make an interpretation based on Table 1. 

$$\\[0.1in]$$

```{r}
read_csv("data/inswath_bf.csv") %>% 
  mutate_if(is_character, ~str_replace(., "[)]", "")) %>% 
  mutate_if(is_character, ~str_replace(., "[(]", "")) %>% 
  dplyr::select(-"Std_Difference") %>% 
  reactable(., theme = fivethirtyeight(),
            filterable = FALSE,
            resizable = TRUE,
            pagination = FALSE,
            wrap = TRUE,
            groupBy = "Level1",
            searchable = FALSE,
            defaultPageSize = 20,
            showSortable = TRUE,
            columns = list(
            Level1 = colDef(filterable = TRUE),
            Level2 = colDef(filterable = TRUE),
            BF = colDef(
              #cell = #function(value) {
#                if (value > 1) paste0("+", value) 
#                else value
#                },
              style = function(value) {
                color <- if (value > 1) {
                  "#008000"
                  } else if (value < 1) {
                    "#e00000"
                  }
                list(fontWeight = 600, color = color)}),
            Difference = colDef(align = "center", 
                                cell = data_bars_pos_neg(., 
                                                         colors = c("#ff3030", "#1e90ff"))))) %>% 
  add_title("Table 2. Treatment contrasts for inswath spray solution deposition. Bayes Factor is used to test contrast hypothesis", font_size = 15)
```

$$\\[0.1in]$$
The treatment contrasts of Area Under the Curve are compared (Table 3). See the BF and make an interpretation based on Table 1.
$$\\[0.1in]$$

```{r}
read_csv("data/auc_bf.csv") %>% 
  mutate_if(is_character, ~str_replace(., "[)]", "")) %>% 
  mutate_if(is_character, ~str_replace(., "[(]", "")) %>% 
  dplyr::select(-"Std_Difference") %>% 
  mutate_if(is.double, ~round(.,2)) %>% 
  reactable(., theme = fivethirtyeight(),
            filterable = FALSE,
            resizable = TRUE,
            pagination = FALSE,
            wrap = TRUE,
            groupBy = "Level1",
            searchable = FALSE,
            defaultPageSize = 20,
             showSortable = TRUE,
            columns = list(
            Level1 = colDef(filterable = TRUE),
            Level2 = colDef(filterable = TRUE),
            BF = colDef(
              #cell = #function(value) {
#                if (value > 1) paste0("+", value) 
#                else value
#                },
              style = function(value) {
                color <- if (value > 1) {
                  "#008000"
                  } else if (value < 1) {
                    "#e00000"
                  }
                list(fontWeight = 600, color = color)}),
#            BF = colDef(align = "center",
#                        cell = color_tiles(., colors = ifelse(. > 1.00, "blue",
#                                                         "red"))),
            Difference = colDef(align = "center", 
                                cell = data_bars_pos_neg(., 
                                                         colors = c("#ff3030", "#1e90ff"))))) %>% 
  add_title("Table 3. Treatment contrasts for Area Under the Curve. Bayes Factor is used to test contrast hypothesis", font_size = 15)
```
